learningContent.title: Testing the DITA Open Toolkit installation

lcInstruction.p: Now that you have installed the DITA Open Toolkit and the required JAVA Development Kit and set up your folder structure, you’re ready to run your first test build. Follow the instructions below to generate a sample PDF file using the DITA OT. Separate instructions are provided for Windows and Mac users.
lcInstruction.note: These instructions only apply to the 2.x versions of the DITA Open Toolkit.

task.title: Running a DITA OT test build

info.p: On Windows: Click Start > Run and type cmd.
On Mac: Launch the Terminal application.

step.cmd: In the command window, type cd followed by the filepath to navigate to the DITA OT folder.

info.note: To enter a filepath without typing it, navigate to the file on your system, click on the file’s icon, and drag the icon directly into the command window. You can use the same action to enter the filepath for the ducks_output folder without typing it.

step.cmd: Type the following string of commands into the command window to run the DITA OT:
Press ENTER to run the DITA Open Toolkit.

info.note: You will see a log of the DITA OT’s build process in realtime displayed in the command window.

step.cmd: Look in the ducks_output folder to see your generated output. You should see a file called m_ducks.pdf.
